column4: but the 32bit version can't support 64bit wifi cards sometimes?
64bit wifi cards? are they bit specific?
don't they use a completely different protocol, independent of the cpu?
yes
but it seems if you have a 64bit system you need to use the 64bit version of the driver for the wifi card
there *are* different 32bit/64bit versions, i don't know why
oh yes, the driver needs to match of course
but if you're 32bit distro is on a 64bit machine, it's hard to get the wireless drivers to work -- if it's a 64bit distro on a 64bit machine, you use the 64bit driver and it works fine
damn english, s/you're/your
oh. I thought 64bit linux is not mature enough for me yet. but if it can do wifi in 32bit mode it's a different story.
i don't think it can
if it cannot I meant of course
yeah, 64bit linux is still lacking
yeah.
I say a year or so probably and will improve
yeap, if i had 64bit hardware i'd run a 32bit OS
up:12kb/sec down:80-250kb/sec (kilobytes/sec)
dslreports.com might have more information
I get 600kb/sec up and 1.5megs/sec down for like 45/50 a month, (Verizon FiOS)
that sounds like a good deal. prices are generally higher in Europe or the connections are slower
don't repeat
and spell don't correctly =P
azureal: damnit, i said please don't repeat. thanks.
